sub_title: Head of Security Analytics ING | Visiting Researcher TUDelft | OpenGroup Thought Leader Data Scientist
summary:
I am a seasoned, results-driven leader with extensive experience in the data science and artificial intelligence fields. As the Head of Security Analytics at ING, I lead the strategic direction and execution of high-quality analytics and data strategy. My expertise in AI, data science, and analytics has been honed through a series of progressive leadership roles, including serving as the AI Practice Leader for IBM Benelux and Principal Data Scientist for IBM Europe, where I played a key role in defining the AI strategy at the EU level and developing industry-aligned AI-powered solutions.

I have a proven track record of delivering value through data-driven insights, with experience in building and validating AI models and consulting for clients at IBM, Mobiquity and Easytobook. My academic background includes a Ph.D. in Atmospheric Physics from Wageningen University, the Netherlands, and several well-cited papers in top-tier international scientific journals. I have received a number of honours and awards in the US, Europe, and Brazil. I am certified as a Distinguished Data Scientist by the OpenGroup, and as of 2022, I act as a board member for the Data Scientist profession certification. In 2023, I became a visiting researcher at the Cybersecurity Lab of the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management at Delft University.

I am adept at leading cross-functional teams and have a proven ability to drive strategic initiatives, leveraging my deep understanding of data science and AI to drive business growth. I am committed to staying at the forefront of the industry and am always looking for ways to bring the latest technologies and best practices to the organisation.

You can check my portfolio here: https://www.edbarbaro.com./

treasury_media.title: Using machine learning for model benchmarking and forecasting of depletion-induced seismicity in the Groningen gas field
treasury_media.description: The Groningen gas field in the Netherlands is experiencing induced seismicity as a result of ongoing depletion. The physical mechanisms that control seismicity have been studied through rock mechanical experiments and combined physical-statistical...

projects.title: Modelling User Engagement in Mobile Applications
projects.description: Mobile applications must keep users active over a sufficiently long period of time to be considered successful nowadays. In this research, we are interested in investigating innovative ways to personalize the user experience. To do so, we advocate the use of a range of intervention strategies. Firstly, we propose a methodology to characterize User Engagement in mobile applications. To achieve that, we will explore three different frameworks: (i) survival analysis models, (ii) regression models, and (iii) random forest models. In doing so, we aim to gain understanding if (and when) a user will disengage after a given period of time. Secondly, we evaluate the performance of our framework in modeling User Engagement. Thirdly, we design a behavior change platform based on the outcome of our modeling framework.

projects.title: Designing and Implementing an Adaptive Recommender Engine
projects.description: We take advantage of a huge collection of data, from several sources, to design an adaptive recommender system for the automobile industry. In this multi-dimensional algorithm, we use information about the car hyperspace: mileage, status, brand-model-type, year of build, and first/second order statistics. Coupled to that, behavioral information and geographical location are also used to train our models. The results show that our modeling approach is able to explain over 96% of the price variance for all car segments. Moreover, our approach flags potential opportunities for a diverse set of cross-selling businesses, such as automotive parts and insurance companies.

projects.title: Clustering with optimised weights for Gower’s metric: Using hierarchical clustering and quasi-Newton methods to maximise the cophenetic correlation coefficient
projects.description:
MSc supervisor of this thesis (VU Amsterdam)

In this thesis, we designed a weighting scheme for Gower’s metric that optimizes the cophenetic correlation coefficient (CPCC) of a hierarchical clustering. We used the limited memory Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno algorithm with bounds to optimize the weights of the Gower’s metric. We validated our approach using both artificial and real data sets and highlighted that the weights are a crucial part of obtaining a more accurate clustering. Our algorithm increased the CPCC from 0.84 to 0.97, in the case of a data set obtained from a mobile application. Furthermore, we can statistically confirm that our optimized hierarchical clustering algorithm performed better than all the benchmark algorithms tested in this thesis on multiple internal evaluation metrics. In addition to that, we extended our framework using an optimized K-medoids implementation with equally good results. Finally, we showed that it is possible to analytically obtain a derivative of the CPCC when certain weights are set constant relative to each other.

projects.title: Bid Recommendation Automated Intelligence Network
projects.description:
Keywords: Machine learning, Big Data, Statistical algorithms, Bidding algorithms, Marketing 

Within the frameworks of (i) machine learning techniques and (ii) big data exploration, our aim is to develop and to maintain an automated bidding algorithm. This algorithm focus on maximizing our return on investment given market constraints e.g. campaign budget and/or inventory availability.Our main focus lies on optimizing our cost-per-click pricing model platforms.

projects.title: Model simulation of the morning transition effect on boundary layer dynamics and chemistry during the PEGASOS campaign in the Netherlands
projects.description:
MSc supervisor of this thesis (Wageningen University)

In this work, we focused on the investigation of the morning transition phenomenon. The importance of studying the morning transition phenomenon is twofold since (i) sets the initial conditions for the convective boundary layer depth development and (ii) defines the timing that the chemicals start to mix with air masses and react with each other throughout the turbulent layer.

profile_positions.description: In this role within CISO, I identify, design, and implement data solutions based on analytics. We apply analytics mainly to Security Detection and Response, Identity and Access Management, and Attack Surface Management. I also spend a lot of my focus on increasing our cybersecurity capabilities and making CISO a more data-driven organisation within ING. Of course, I do that with a phenomenal team of data scientists and data engineers. We work together to assess the quality of the current solutions and provide technical/strategic expertise in several areas within cybersecurity.
profile_positions.title: Head of Security Analytics

profile_positions.description: As Chief Product Owner for Security Detection, I live and breathe data, analytics, and AI. I work with various multi-colour teams (red, blue, purple), engineers, architects and manage the development and deployment of new and existing security products and services. One of my primary goals is to treat security detection as a data problem and use artificial intelligence and analytics techniques to tackle it. I also develop the vision and the roadmap in line with the Global CISO Strategy.
profile_positions.title: Chief Product Owner for Security Detection

profile_positions.description: In this role, I managed and operated the Cognitive & Analytics Practice in the Benelux. I focused on ensuring my team had the right skills to deliver AI ahead of market demand and develop the right culture through the ability to attract, develop, and retain the best AI talent in the market. I worked closely with other teams, account partners and industry leaders, locally and on European level, to bring ethical, understandable, reproducible, sustainable, long-term, intelligent solutions to clients.
profile_positions.title: Practice Lead Cognitive & Analytics Benelux

profile_positions.description: As the Principal Data Scientist for Europe, I acted as an interface between the local and EU practice to foster and facilitate a bidirectional integration between the market teams. I also focused on AI enablement across different markets and acted as the focal point and key influencer in the market for IBM's European Data Science Community.
profile_positions.title: Principal Data Scientist, IBM Europe

profile_positions.description: In this position, I acted as the IBM Ambassador within the Dutch AI ecosystem. I was the focal point for all AI-related initiatives and actions as well as for IBM's AI strategy. In this role, I was also a spokesperson and keynote speaker for all AI-related matters. I represented IBM in the NLAIC, FME, and NEN boards.
profile_positions.title: AI Leader IBM Netherlands

profile_positions.description: I worked in a broad catalogue of client-facing projects at IBM. I used the experience gathered from my academic/industry backgrounds to help design and execute solutions that not only make mathematical sense but can be further implemented and understood by fellow data scientists up to the C-suit. As part of the advanced analytics team, I appreciate the collaboration with an inspiring group of colleagues daily. Mentoring more junior data scientists and organising knowledge exchange sessions for broader audiences within IBM helped me to learn and spread new ideas within the organisation.
profile_positions.title: Lead Data Scientist BeNeLux | Senior Managing Consultant | Analytics lead
Lead Data Scientist BeNeLux | Strategy Managing Consultant
Senior Data Scientist BeNeLux | Strategy Managing Consultant

profile_positions.description: At Mobiquity, I worked for different clients with cutting-edge analytical techniques to design innovative data-driven business solutions. I also engaged in behavior analytics work analyzing short- and long-term behavior patterns to tailor interventions based on an individual’s preferences and needs. Besides that, I enjoyed being part of a team while still having the freedom to develop my ideas. Supervising BSc, MSc, and Ph.D. students was also a part of my day at Mobiquity.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: I managed the modeling, development, and optimization of data mining algorithms for several travel communities, such as TripAdvisor, Trivago, and Google Price Ads. As a data analyst at Easytobook.com, I built a bidding strategy focused on augmenting marketing revenue while increasing market share. I was responsible for generating, on average, €3M in revenue per month.
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst

profile_positions.description: My Ph.D. work focused on understanding and quantifying the role of aerosols on the nonlinear dynamics of the atmospheric boundary layer. Specifically, I addressed the dynamic coupling between aerosols, radiation and the land-atmosphere system under a large-eddy simulation framework.
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: I worked as a volunteer teaching Physics and Mathematics to students (>17 yr). Their aim was to get them admitted to a University program in Brazil.
I work as a volunteer helping people recover from financially difficult situations.
